      • getMaxCount

        public int getMaxCount()
        Description copied from interface: ElementCounter
        Returns the maximal countable number of this element. The default is set to 10 (ElementDefaults.COUNTER_MAXIMUM).
        Specified by:
        getMaxCount in interface ElementCounter
        Returns:
        the maximal countable number of this element

      • getMinCount

        public int getMinCount()
        Description copied from interface: ElementCounter
        Returns the minimal countable number of this element. The default is set to 1 (ElementDefaults.COUNTER_MINIMUM).
        Specified by:
        getMinCount in interface ElementCounter
        Returns:
        the minimal countable number of this element

      • setMaxCount

        public void setMaxCount(int maxCount)
        Description copied from interface: ElementCounter
        Sets the maximal countable number to this element. If the new count is greater than 64 the count will be set automaticly to 64.
        Specified by:
        setMaxCount in interface ElementCounter
        Parameters:
        maxCount - change to

      • setMinCount

        public void setMinCount(int minCount)
        Description copied from interface: ElementCounter
        Sets the minimal countable number to this element. If the new count is smaller than 1 the count will be set automaticly to 1.
        Specified by:
        setMinCount in interface ElementCounter
        Parameters:
        minCount - change to

      • setCount

        public void setCount(int count)
        Description copied from interface: ElementCounter
        Sets the current displayed count. If the new count does not match the frame of minimal and maximal count, the new count will be adapted.
        Specified by:
        setCount in interface ElementCounter
        Parameters:
        count - change to

      • increment

        public void increment()
        Description copied from interface: ElementCounter
        Adds to the current count 1. To set the new count ElementCounter.setCount(int) will be used.
        Specified by:
        increment in interface ElementCounter

      • countdown

        public void countdown()
        Description copied from interface: ElementCounter
        Subtracts 1 of the current count. To set the new count ElementCounter.setCount(int) will be used.
        Specified by:
        countdown in interface ElementCounter

      • addIncrementer

        public void addIncrementer(ElementButton btn,
                           int value)
        Description copied from interface: ElementCounter
        Adds to an ElementButton a listener to increment this element. The value to add by clicking the button can be specified. If the user shiftclicks the button, the value to add will multiplied by 2. You can also set the value to a number smaller than 0 to subtract counts from this element by clicking the button.
        Specified by:
        addIncrementer in interface ElementCounter
        Parameters:
        btn - add the listener to
        value - incremented by clicking
